tagline.title: FULL DAY KINTAMANI AND PENGLIPURAN TOUR IS ONE DAY TRIP FOR SEE VIEW MT. BATUR VOLCANO AND SEE TRADITIONAL VILLAGE WITH ANCIENT HOUSE
tagline.text: FULL DAY KINTAMANI AND PENGLIPURAN TOUR IS ONE DAY TRIP FOR SEE VIEW MT. BATUR VOLCANO AND SEE TRADITIONAL VILLAGE WITH ANCIENT HOUSE
tagline.html: FULL DAY KINTAMANI AND PENGLIPURAN TOUR IS ONE DAY TRIP FOR SEE VIEW MT. BATUR VOLCANO AND SEE TRADITIONAL VILLAGE WITH ANCIENT HOUSE

description.text: Kintamani and Penglipuran Tour is a one day tour to visit Penglipuran village with ancient houses and see the view of Batur volcano from Kintamani village, a combination tour that is very suitable for you to see the natural beauty and unique culture on the island of Bali. First, our tour driver will pick you up at your place of stay in the morning and visit the first tourist destination, namely Goa Gajah Temple, a historical site about the remains of statue relics from ancient times, followed by visiting Penglipuran Village, an ancient village that still maintains their traditions, where the house is located. - Residents' houses are still like old times, a suitable place for you to find out about ancient life on the island of Bali, continue to Kintamani village to see views of the volcano and Lake Batur from this place, a very beautiful natural view, continue to the restaurant to enjoy lunch with Indonesian food buffet lunch, while having lunch, you can also enjoy the view of the Batur volcano from the restaurant, continue to the Coffee Plantation which is a place to see the process making traditional Balinese coffee and luwak and you can also experience the free coffee tasting provided, but if you want to taste coffee luwak there will be an additional fee, continue visiting Tirta Empul Temple, a Hindu holy place which functions as a place of self-purification with holy water. comes from a spring that is purified in this place, if you want to carry out the process of self-purification there will be additional costs for renting a locker and sarong to go to the purification pool, because this tour is only sightseeing and does not involve self-purification activities. After that we will go to the hotel with a very impressive experience on this one day trip to Kintamani and Penglipuran Village accompanied by a professional and experienced driver who will make the trip even more enjoyable.

After that we will go to the hotel with a very impressive experience on this one day trip to Kintamani and Penglipuran Village accompanied by a professional and experienced driver who will make the trip even more enjoyable.

title.title: Goa Gajah Temple | Kintamani and Penglipuran Tour

image.title: Kintamani and Penglipuran Tour | Goa Gajah Temple | Bali Golden Tour

description.text: First site we visit during Kintamani and Penglipuran Tour is visiting Goa Gajah Temple is a heritage site from ancient times, which has been preserved until now, Goa Gajah temple was built in the period 10-11 AD, which at that time was the dynasty of the Warmadewa kingdom, while the name Goa Gajah refers to the statue of Ganesha found engraved on the cave wall. In 1923 the elephant cave site was discovered by L.C Heyting who at the time of discovery, he found Archa Ganesha, a statue of Tri Langga and also a statue of Hariti. The word of Goa Gajah is anticipated coming from the word of Lwa Gajah, the name of Buddhist Temple or hermitage for Buddhist monk. The Goa Gajah's name is written on Negara Kertagama papyrus which is compiled by Mpu Prapanca on 1365 M.
description.html: First site we visit during Kintamani and Penglipuran Tour is visiting Goa Gajah Temple is a heritage site from ancient times, which has been preserved until now, Goa Gajah temple was built in the period 10-11 AD, which at that time was the dynasty of the Warmadewa kingdom, while the name Goa Gajah refers to the statue of Ganesha found engraved on the cave wall. In 1923 the elephant cave site was discovered by L.C Heyting who at the time of discovery, he found Archa Ganesha, a statue of Tri Langga and also a statue of Hariti. The word of Goa Gajah is anticipated coming from the word of Lwa Gajah, the name of Buddhist Temple or hermitage for Buddhist monk. The Goa Gajah's name is written on Negara Kertagama papyrus which is compiled by Mpu Prapanca on 1365 M.

title.title: Penglipuran Village | Kintamani and Penglipuran Tour

image.title: Kintamani and Penglipuran Tour | Penglipuran Village | Bali Golden Tour

description.text: Second site we visit during Kintamani and Penglipuran Tour is visiting Penglipuran Village, is a very unique village, where it still maintains a beautiful rural face like in the past, without being eroded by the modern side of the building, if you visit here you can see the shape of the house in a past life like this original. Penglipuran Traditional Village is a rural area that has a specific structure from a traditional village structure, so that it is able to display a beautiful rural face. The physical arrangement of the village structure is inseparable from the culture of the community that has been passed down from generation to generation. Thus, Penglipuran Traditional Village is a cultural tourism site. The beauty of the Penglipuran Traditional Village can be felt starting from entering the pre-village area with green grass on the edge of the road

title.title: Kintamani View Mt. Batur Volcano | Kintamani and Penglipuran Tour

image.title: Kintamani and Penglipuran Tour | Kintamani View Mt. Batur Volcano | Bali Golden Tour

description.text: Third site we visit during Kintamani and Penglipuran Tour is visit Kintamani Village, is a one of the village in Bangli district, what is interesting about Kintamani village is the view of Mount Batur, from Kintamani village we can see views of Mount Batur Volcano and Lake Batur from a distance, we can see the full view from this place, a combination of Mount Batur and the expanse of black rock with Lake Batur and on a blue caldera make perfect scenery, in this place there is a special place where we can enjoy this view, the location of the place name is Penelokan Vilage. Being at an altitude of 1500 meters above sea level with cold and sometimes foggy weather making the atmosphere very cold. There are also restaurants lined up on the cliffs with views of the Batur volcano, we will have lunch at this place with a very delicious Indonesian food buffet.

title.title: Bali Coffee Plantation | Kintamani and Penglipuran Tour

image.title: Kintamani and Penglipuran Tour | Coffee Plantations | Bali Golden Tour

description.text: Fourth site we visit during Kintamani and Penglipuran Tour is to visit Coffee plantation or better known as Agrotourism is a tourist spot where we can see the process of making traditional Balinese coffee and also see the process of making the famous Luwak coffee, done manually with very satisfying results. In this place there is a display of coffee and tea made by local farmers at affordable prices, and you can also try to taste the delicious taste of Luwak coffee with your own expenses. The resulting Bali Coffee Luwak is said to be like no other in the world (literally). It has a rich, heavy flavor with hints of caramel and/or chocolate. Other terms used to describe it are earthy, musty and exotic. The body can be syrupy and it's the smoothest coffee you will ever have.The taste of civet coffee is very complete

title.title: Tirta Empul Temple | Kintamani and Penglipuran Tour

image.title: Kintamani and Penglipuran Tour | Tirta Empul Temple| Bali Golden Tour

description.text: Fifth site we visit during Kintamani and Penglipuran Tour is to visit Tirta Empul Temple, is a holy place for Hindus located in the village of Selamat Siring, Gianyar Regency, this place functions as a place to purify oneself with the holy water found in this temple. Tirta Empul Temple was built during the reign of King Masula and Masuli which can be seen from Usana Bali's papyrus. Tirta Empul Temple whose sacred spring is said to have been created by Indra and to have curative properties. The tradition continues almost unchanged at the temple today. Over 1000 years old, the temple and its two bathing places have been used by the people for good health and prosperity because of the spring water's curative powers. Many tourists come here to purify themselves in the purification pool found in this Tirta Empul temple

price.title: Kintamani and Penglipuran Tour Price :
price.content:
Kintamani and Penglipuran Tour Price :

The tour we provide is Based on Private Tour, We offer two price you can choose which is Regular Tours Price and Inclusive Tours Price, Please see below the details of West Bali Tour Packages price :

Regular Tours Price :

IDR 550,000/car ( 1 till 6 person included)
IDR 950,000/minibus ( 1 till 12 person included)
IDR 1,250,000/minibus ( 1 till 17 person included)
IDR 2,500,000/bus ( 1 till 30 person included)
Inclusion : Private Car / Minibus / Bus with Good A/C + Petrol + English Speaking Driver
Note : Parking Fee, Entrance fee and Lunch is not include in the price

Or

Inclusive Tours Price :

IDR 700,000/person
Note : For Inclusive Price is minimun Booking 2 Person
Inclusion : Private Car / Minibus / Bus with Good A/C + Petrol + Parking Fee + English Speaking Driver + Entrance Fee + Lunch Indonesian Food + Mineral Water

content.event: Visit Goa Gajah Temple
Visit Kintamani for View Mt. Batur
Visit Tirta Empul Temple

inclusion:
Seminyak, Legian, Kuta, Nusa Dua, Jimbaran, Pecatu, Sanur, Ubud, Canggu, Denpasar, Benoa Harbour, Airport
Please contact us for pick up in different area

• The price already include with 21% Government tax and Services
  • Get special price for group booking
  • Regular Tours Price : is a Bali day tours price without include lunch and entrance fee, you need to pay by your own self
  • Inclusive Tours Price : is a Bali day tours price with include lunch and entrance fee
  • The tour is Private Tours, means there is no other participant, just only you and your companion
  • The Tour will assist by English Speaking Tours Driver
  • Tour Guide can be requested, contact us if you want to request Tour Guide during the trip
  • Time and Tourism site is subject to change based on your request.
  • Use contact form provide to send us message, asking information or make tour booking request.

• Payment is Cash Payment
  • Payment is on the day itself with our driver
  • Payment with other currency will convert based on daily exchange rate
